summary: The Gunnison Outdoor Resources Protection Act of 2025 designates various areas in Gunnison County, Colorado, for special management, wildlife conservation, protection, recreation, and scientific research. It defines terms, outlines permitted uses (including limitations on vehicle/bicycle use), mandates winter travel management plans, and designates new wilderness areas. The bill also addresses land to be held in trust for the Ute Mountain Ute Tribe, addresses water rights, outlines seasonal closures, restoration activities, and general provisions regarding land management and use.
